cold_snaps.status: At present, there is no cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps occur annually.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The storm today is ranked 8th for the amount of rainfall recorded during one storm.  13.04mm fell at a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour over 7.9 hours.  The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 27.64mm reaching 4.6mm per hour at times.  The event lasted 15.9 hours.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today, the rain fell at an intense rate peaking at 27.0mm per hour, one of the heaviest downpours recorded and ranked highest from our records.  The precipitation lasted 2.0 hours and dumped 7.99mm in total.

storm.status: Rain fell for 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 creating a new record.  The storm produced a total of 24.56mm at a maximum intensity of 6.4mm per hour.
We are currently experiencing a storm.  This is the first such event since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 26 August 2025, is ranked 5th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 9 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (201°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 73.05 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C) and outside temperature (up 3.0°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1545 m), light levels (up 3071 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 46.4m higher than yesterday, 436.7m lower than the past week, 1545.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1113.3m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and little or no wind. Periods of rain anticipated, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
